page.title: 02Growth of Capel St Mary
page.content: In 1957 Capel was a small scattered village with a population of 600.With the Parish Council's help a playing field was bought.Suffolk then decided to expand Capel and builders bought the playing field.Two firms Wimpey and Comben began building on farmland North and south of the main street.The population of Capel grew to 2500.The Parish Council and the new Community Council bought a recreation ground and through local fund raising and grants built a Village hall and pub.A new library started in Jan '85 and opening in Aug has been added.There will be one assistant and 3,850 books.People can join at the age of 13 and under 13's can join with parents.4 books will be allowed each time.As the village grew a doctor's surgery and pharmacy,a dentist and a new shopping area were added.
